conclusion: Consider forces acting on the conductor rod due to magnetic field and tension in the wire.
Magnetic force on a conductor in a magnetic field is given by F = I * B * L.
Tension in the thin wire is zero, implying net force on conductor is zero.
Magnetic force F must be equal to the weight of the conductor rod mg.
Set magnetic force equal to weight: I * B * L = mg.
Direction of current is from negative z-axis to positive z-axis.
Magnitude of current I1 is 0.2 A, direction from negative z-axis to positive z-axis.
